examples: The man who stole from the poor was a callous thief
Kiera looked at Evelyn, astonished by her callous words
He was only a callow youth
Untraveled, naive, even a little callow, we are not surprised to discover the heart of a hero just waiting to be stirred to action

camaraderie.definition: Mutual trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together
examples: The feeling of camaraderie in these groups was different to others
It was a tough, demanding existence but he enjoyed the camaraderie

camouflage.definition: Hide or disguise the presence of (a person, animal, or object) by means of camouflage
examples: Its size was camouflaged by the surrounding forest and technology
The soldiers camouflaged themselves with leaves
The owner was candid about the failures as well as the successes
I don't know how candid you can be with Julie
